clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparative Study on Trans-umbilical Single-port Laparoscopic Extra-peritoneal Approach Versus Conventional Repair for Inguinal Hernia in Children

brief_summary.textblock: Inguinal hernia is a common disease in children. Treatment of this disease by laparoscopic high ligation of the hernia sac has been accepted by domestic and foreign scholars. Since laparoscopic inguinal hernia was introduced in 1990,it has now become the most commonly performed hernia repair in children. The conventional approach this is done with2small trocars to 1trocar . however the wound complications of infection and pain and the recurrent rate have not been resolved. The aim of the study was to described a new way of extra-peritoneal high ligation of hernia sac. This method combines the single-port laparoscopic could eliminated rate of wound complications and recurrence in inguinal hernia repair in children. The investigators hoped that this study will prove that the extra-peritoneal single-port laparoscopic repair is at least a s effective and efficient as the conventional technique in the cure of inguinal hernia and may results in lower recurrence and reduce incidence of wound complications.

primary_outcome.measure: conversion to intraabdominal high ligation of inguinal hernia
primary_outcome.description: this study is to determine whether extra-peritoneal single-port laparoscopic repair for inguinal hernia in children is superior to conventional repair approaches.

the 150 patients were subjected trans-umbilical single-port laparoscopic intraabdominal approach repair for inguinal hernia

study_pop.textblock: All patients between 6 months and 13 years undergoing trans-umbilical single-port laparoscopic approach repair for inguinal hernia at our institution. half of patients undergoing extra-peritoneal andthe others undergoing intraabdominal.
